page.title: 20Services:Hutton & Gillamoor
page.content: The villages are well served by travelling vans selling bread, groceries, meat,fish, tea and milk, which call several times a week.The mobile Library comes once a fortnight. Newspapers are delivered by a village resident. The nearest doctor is at Kirkbymoorside and an excellent District Nursing Service is available. Ryedale District Council provides a weekly refuse collection. There are no pavements or street lighting in either village (neither wanted!). There is no mains gas in the area. Each village has a telephone kiosk and a post box. Each Wednesday a bus goes to Kirkby_ moorside Market returning after two hours. A Saturday service to Malton market operates every fortnight. A shared taxi service operates from Appleton-le-Moors. Tourist Service Bus runs from York in summer.
